title: Drivers on I-95 Remain Stranded Due to Winter Storm in Virginia
sub_head: Over 14 inches of snow fell in Fredericksburg and stretches of the interstate remain closed
body:
Many drivers remained stranded in their cars without supplies along a stretch of Interstate-95 south of Washington, D.C., after a winter storm dumped 14 inches of snow and brought traffic to a standstill for more than 24 hours.
By Tuesday afternoon, the majority of motorists remained stranded, some of whom became stuck as early as Monday morning, Virginia Department of Transportation Fredericksburg District Engineer Marcie Parker said in a conference call with reporters.
